definitions.definition: Especially of a character in film or literature: one who is of interest as a (potential) partner in love.
A romantic relationship; a romance.
Careful attention.
To guard, protect.
To mind; to regard with care; to take notice of; to attend to; to observe.
To pay attention, care.
A familiar, invented given name for a person or thing used instead of the actual name of the person or thing.
A kind of byname that describes a person by a characteristic of that person.
To give a nickname to (a person or thing).
A person who depends on another for support, particularly financial support (= US dependent).
Relying upon; depending upon.
definitions.example: At that point I was dependent on financial aid for my tuition.

definitions.definition: Having a probability that is affected by the outcome of a separate event.
(of Scottish Gaelic, Manx and Irish verb forms) Used in questions, negative sentences and after certain particles and prepositions.
Affecting the lower part of the body, such as the legs while standing up, or the back while supine.
Hanging down.
definitions.example: a dependent bough or leaf

definitions.definition: To reverse or recant (a previous decision).
A voter etc. who has not yet come to a decision.
Open and not yet settled or determined.
definitions.example: The question of man's destiny is still undecided.

definitions.definition: Uncommitted, not having reached a decision.
definitions.example: The result of the election is in doubt because of a large number of undecided voters.

definitions.definition: A raised platform in a church, usually enclosed, where the minister or preacher stands when giving the sermon.

Activity performed from a church pulpit, in other words, preaching, sermons, religious teaching, the preaching profession, preachers collectively or an individual preaching position; by extension: bully pulpit.
A raised desk, lectern, or platform for an orator or public speaker.

The railing at the bow of a boat, which sometimes extends past the deck. It is sometimes referred to as bow pulpit. The railing at the stern of the boat is sometimes referred to as a stern pulpit; other texts use the term pushpit.
A bow platform for harpooning.
A plane's cockpit.
An inversion of the relationship between the elements of phrases.
A word which is pronounced the same as another word but differs in spelling or meaning or origin.
A letter or group of letters which are pronounced the same as another letter or group of letters.
A person who fights; a combatant.
A warrior; fighting soldier.
A pugnacious, competitive person.
(eulogistic) A person with a strong determination to resist protracted or severe adversity, especially illness.

A class of fixed-wing aircraft whose primary purpose is that of shooting down other aircraft. Some of these (Fighter-Attack or Attack aircraft) also have a secondary purpose of attacking ground targets.
A boxer or participant in any martial art.
A firefighter
A game with a focus on physical combat.
Stern, harsh and forbidding.
Unyielding and obstinate.
Expressing gloom or melancholy; sullenly unhappy.
The amount of money outstanding that was borrowed by a government in order to finance expenditure not covered by taxation
A device that measures the magnitude of an electric current, especially one calibrated in amperes.
Matter that is composed of the antiparticles of those that constitute normal matter.
A form of matter that has a key property, such as charge, opposite to that of ordinary matter.
One of the wooden targets used in skittles.
To play skittles.
To beat comprehensively.
To knock down.
Any of the joints between the phalanges of the fingers.
(by extension) A mechanical joint.
A cut of meat.
The curved part of the cushion at the entrance to the pockets on a cue sports table.
The kneejoint of a quadruped, especially of a calf; formerly used of the kneejoint of a human being.
The joint of a plant.
A convex portion of a vessel's figure where a sudden change of shape occurs, as in a canal boat, where a nearly vertical side joins a nearly flat bottom.
A contrivance, usually of brass or iron, and furnished with points, worn to protect the hand, to add force to a blow, and to disfigure the person struck; a knuckle duster.
definitions.example: brass knuckles

definitions.definition: The rounded point where a flat changes to a slope on a piste.
To apply pressure, or rub or massage with one's knuckles.
definitions.example: He knuckled the sleep from his eyes.

definitions.definition: To bend the fingers.
To touch one's forehead as a mark of respect.
To yield.
A gun that propels a projectile by compressed air.
The assorted objects, such as pots, pans, baking sheets, etc., used for cooking
A reproduction of a single article from a journal or similar publication.
definitions.example: I got a lot of requests for offprints of my paper on cold fusion.

definitions.definition: To reprint as an excerpt.
definitions.example: Articles from some magazines are offprinted from other magazines.

definitions.definition: A high-speed passenger train in Japan which runs at speeds from 200-300 kilometers per hour on the shinkansen network.
A high-speed train which resembles such a train.
Suicide by small firearm; see take the bullet train.
definitions.example: “I should probably take the bullet train, and save her the grief.”

definitions.definition: A bright purple synthetic dye.
The colour of this dye; a pale purple or violet colour.
Having a pale purple colour.
A man who tends free-range cattle, especially in the American West.
A man who identifies with cowboy culture, including wearing a cowboy hat and being a fan of country and western music.
A person who engages in reckless behavior, especially for the purpose of showing off.
A dishonest and/or incompetent independent tradesman.
A playing card of king rank.
To work as a cowboy, herding cattle.
To develop again or differently.
definitions.example: to redevelop an unsuccessful product for relaunch

definitions.definition: To intensify by a second process.
To convert a neighbourhood by demolishing old buildings and building new ones, or by renovating existing ones.
A temporary interruption or cessation of a normal activity
A mobile phone device specifically designed for and fitted into an automobile.
The final battle between two nemeses, in which there can be but one victor.
The final round in a poker match, where the all remaining players' cards have to be put down on the table and shown.
An efferent blood vessel from the heart, conveying blood away from the heart regardless of oxygenation status; see pulmonary artery.
A major transit corridor.
Exhausted
(usually in the plural) A payment of time, effort or money to undo past transgression(s).
The act of renewing, restoring, etc., or the state of being renewed or repaired.
definitions.example: the reparation of a bridge or of a highway

definitions.definition: The past performance of a person, organization, or product, viewed in its entirety and usually for the purpose of making a judgment.
Whooping cough.
A flat bread pouch used for making sandwiches such as gyros or falafels.
Any passerine belonging to the taxonomic family Pittidae.
Birdwatching
The catching of birds; fowling
An aquatic blood-sucking annelid of class Hirudinea, especially Hirudo medicinalis.
A person who derives profit from others in a parasitic fashion.
A glass tube designed for drawing blood from damaged tissue by means of a vacuum.
To apply a leech medicinally, so that it sucks blood from the patient.
To drain (resources) without giving back.
definitions.example: Bert leeched hundreds of files from the BBS, but never uploaded anything in return.

definitions.definition: A physician.
(Heathenry) A healer.
To treat, cure or heal.
The vertical edge of a square sail.
The aft edge of a triangular sail.
Any substance tending to induce hallucination.
A chain or range of rocks, sand, or coral lying at or near the surface of the water.
A large vein of auriferous quartz; hence, any body of rock yielding valuable ore.
A portion of a sail rolled and tied down to lessen the area exposed in a high wind.
A reef knot.
To take in part of a sail in order to adapt the size of the sail to the force of the wind.
To pull or yank strongly, especially in relation to horse riding.
(of paddles) To move the floats of a paddle wheel toward its center so that they will not dip so deeply.
definitions.example: Reef the paddles.

definitions.definition: The itch; any eruptive skin disorder.
Dandruff.
Scabby; scurvy.
To persuade a customer to buy more than he or she had intended.
The sequence of digits used to identify a particular destination telephone in a network.
(in the plural) A large number.
definitions.example: How much is that Rolls Royce? We are talking telephone numbers.

definitions.definition: An athletics discipline that takes place on the field, such as hammer, javelin, triple jump
A fruit-bearing shrub or small tree, Punica granatum.
The fruit of Punica granatum, about the size of an orange and having a red pulp containing many seeds and enclosed in a thick, hard, reddish skin.
A dark red colour, like that of a pomegranate.
A noun that denotes any member, or all members, of a class; an ordinary noun such as "dog" or "city".
A two-seater car, normally a sports car. (variant of coupe)
A car with a fixed-roof body style that is shorter than a sedan or saloon of the same model.
The front part of a French stagecoach.
A four-wheeled carriage with two seats inside, and a separate seat for the driver.
The front compartment of a railway carriage.
The strongest grade of Spanish saffron, akin to the Iranian sargol.
The outer covering of a fruit or seed.
Any covering.
To remove the outer covering of a fruit or seed.
definitions.example: She sat on the back porch hulling peanuts.

definitions.definition: The body or frame of a vessel, such as a ship or plane.

(of a set A) The smallest set that possesses a particular property (such as convexity) and contains every point of A; slightly more formally, the intersection of all sets which possess the specified property and of which A is a subset.
definitions.example: The orthogonal convex hull of an orthogonal polygon is the smallest orthogonally convex polygon that encloses the original polygon.

definitions.definition: To drift; to be carried by the impetus of wind or water on the ship's hull alone, with sails furled.
To hit (a ship) in the hull with cannon fire etc.
Guaranteed to work
definitions.example: That hat should be a sure-fire way to spot him in a crowd.

definitions.definition: The act of using a word, particularly an adjective or verb, to apply to more than one noun when its sense is appropriate to only one.
Syllepsis.
An impassioned, disputatious public speech.
A tirade, harsh scolding or rant, whether spoken or written.
definitions.example: She gave her son a harangue about the dangers of playing in the street.

definitions.definition: To give a forceful and lengthy lecture or criticism to someone.
definitions.example: The angry motorist leapt from his car to harangue the other driver.

definitions.definition: One who lags behind; one who takes more time than is necessary or than the others in a group.
Lagging behind; taking more time than the others in a group.
(animal husbandry) Not growing as quickly as the rest of the flock or herd.
definitions.example: The laggard broilers are euthanized and incinerated.

definitions.definition: Region immediately outside of the Arctic Circle or regions similar to these in climate or conditions of life.
Of, relating to, or characteristic of the subarctic.
(grammar) A word preceding a noun to indicate that the noun refers to any member of the class of objects named by the noun.
The practice of using action to achieve a result, such as political demonstration or a strike in support of or in opposition to an issue.
A member of the Macropodidae family of large marsupials with strong hind legs for hopping, native to Australia.
A hooded jacket with a front pocket, usually of fleece material, a kangaroo jacket.
To practice kangaroo care on an infant; to hold a premature infant against the skin.
To hunt kangaroo.
To move like a kangaroo
Of or relating to Australia.
(investments) Characterized by rapidly jumping prices in securities markets or by belief that the prices are unstable in contrast to bear and bull markets.
To burn the flesh with a hot iron, either as a marker (for criminals, slaves etc.) or to cauterise a wound.
definitions.example: When they caught him, he was branded and then locked up.

definitions.definition: To mark (especially cattle) with a brand as proof of ownership.
definitions.example: The ranch hands had to brand every new calf by lunchtime.

definitions.definition: To make an indelible impression on the memory or senses.
definitions.example: Her face is branded upon my memory.

definitions.definition: To stigmatize, label (someone).
definitions.example: He was branded a fool by everyone that heard his story.

definitions.definition: To associate a product or service with a trademark or other name and related images.
definitions.example: They branded the new detergent "Suds-O", with a nature scene inside a green O on the muted-colored recycled-cardboard box.

definitions.definition: The process in which a mark, usually a symbol or ornamental pattern, is burned into the skin of a living person or animal.
The promotion of a commercial brand of product in order to give it greater public awareness.
A specially frozen surface of water on which people skate or play ice hockey.
A building that houses such a surface.
A small carnivorous mammal of the Old World that resembles a weasel, Martes zibellina, from cold regions in Eurasia and the North Pacific islands, valued for its dark brown fur (Wikipedia).
The marten, especially Martes americana (syn. Mustela americana).
The fur or pelt of the sable or other species of martens; a coat made from this fur.
An artist's brush made from the fur of the sable (Wikipedia).
A black colour on a coat of arms (Wikipedia).
A dark brown colour, resembling the fur of some sables.
(in the plural, sables) Black garments, especially worn in mourning.
Of the black colour sable.
: In blazon, of the colour black.
Made of sable fur.
Dark, somber.
Dark-skinned; black.
Work done out in the fields as opposed to that done elsewhere on the farm (e.g., barn, house, outbuildings, office).
Work done out in the real world rather than in controlled conditions
definitions.example: That well Bob set up last weekend was some good fieldwork.

definitions.definition: (in scientific research) The collection of raw data in the field, field research, field study, field studies.
definitions.example: I thought the fieldwork in the course I was taking was going to be hard, but it was just interviewing people.

definitions.definition: A temporary fortification built by troops in the field.
definitions.example: Billy's out building some fieldwork so that our enemies don't walk right over us.

definitions.definition: A violent ejection, such as the spurting out of lava from a volcano.
A sudden release of pressure or tension.
definitions.example: There was an eruption of joy at the final whistle.

definitions.definition: An infection of the skin resulting in a rash or blemishing.
A usually small and narrow street or alley, especially one in inferior or poorer parts of a city, away from the centre.
A secret, clandestine or illegal scene.
Associated with neighborhoods on back streets, often in older neighborhoods, with poorer residents.
The act of cooking in simmering liquid.
To cook something in simmering liquid.
To be cooked in simmering liquid
To become soft or muddy.
To make soft or muddy.
definitions.example: Cattle coming to drink had punched and poached the river bank into a mess of mud.

definitions.definition: To stab; to pierce; to spear, as fish.
To force, drive, or plunge into anything.
To begin and not complete.
The act of taking something unfairly, as in tennis doubles where one player returns a shot that their partner was better placed to return.
To take game or fish illegally.
To take anything illegally or unfairly.
To entice (an employee or customer) to switch from a competing company to one's own.
A measure for cloth. An English ell was 1 1/4 yards (45 inches), whereas a Scottish ell measured only about 37 inches and a Flemish ell was 3/4 yard (27 inches).
The name of the Latin-script letter L.
An extension usually at right angles to one end of a building.
Something that is L-shaped.
Shaped like a triangle.
Of, or pertaining to, triangles.
Having a triangle as a base; as, a triangular prism, a triangular pyramid.
Having three elements or parties; trilateral, tripartite.

Any of the medium-sized to large feliform carnivores of the subfamily Hyaeninae (genera Hyaena and Crocuta), native to Africa and Asia and noted for the sound similar to laughter which they can make if excited.
(Sub-Saharan Africa) A man that performs ritualized sex acts with recently widowed women and menarchal girls.
A lenitive; an emollient.
Lax; not strict; tolerant of dissent or deviation
definitions.example: The standard is fairly lenient, so use your discretion.

definitions.definition: (grammar) The vocative case
(grammar) A word in the vocative case
Something said to (or as though to) a particular person or thing; an entreaty, an invocation.
Of or pertaining to calling; used in calling or vocation.
(grammar) Used in address; appellative (said of that case or form of the noun, pronoun, or adjective, in which a person or thing is addressed). For example "Domine, O Lord"
Any of various radical social or political movements that aim at fundamental change in the structure of society
A large triangular bone at the base of the spine, located between the two ilia (wings of the pelvis) and formed from vertebrae that fuse in adulthood.

A method of self-defence established in Japan emphasizing “jū” (soft or gentle) “jutsu” (art or technique). Japanese martial art that utilizes a large variety of techniques in defense against an opponent.
Brazilian jiu-jitsu, a related art, derived from judo.
Precision maneuvering.
To roll (something) down; to unroll.
To be inherited by someone else; to pass down upon the next person in a succession, especially through failure or loss of an earlier holder.
To delegate (a responsibility, duty, etc.) on or upon someone.
To fall as a duty or responsibility on or upon someone.
To degenerate; to break down.
definitions.example: A discussion about politics may devolve into a shouting match.

definitions.definition: A member of the medieval philosophical school of scholasticism; a medieval Christian Aristotelian.
Of or relating to school; academic
definitions.example: This award is for the greatest scholastic achievement by a graduating student.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the philosophical tradition of scholasticism
Characterized by excessive subtlety, or needlessly minute subdivisions; pedantic; formal.
Of, facing, situated in, or related to the north-west
(of a wind) blowing from the north-west; north-westerly
A system of rules and principles for speaking and writing a language.
The study of the internal structure of words (morphology) and the use of words in the construction of phrases and sentences (syntax).
A book describing the rules of grammar of a language.
A formal system specifying the syntax of a language.
Actual or presumed prescriptive notions about the correct use of a language.
A formal system defining a formal language
The basic rules or principles of a field of knowledge or a particular skill.
A textbook.
definitions.example: a grammar of geography

definitions.definition: A grammar school.
definitions.example: 2012, Graeme Paton, A green light for more grammars? (in The Daily Telegraph, 11 January 2012)

definitions.definition: To discourse according to the rules of grammar; to use grammar.
A palatal consonant.
Pertaining to the palate.
Of an upper tooth, on the side facing the palate.
Articulated at the hard palate.
(auxiliary) A syntactic marker.
To perform; to execute.
definitions.example: All you ever do is surf the Internet. What will you do this afternoon?

definitions.definition: To cause, make (someone) (do something).
To suffice.
definitions.example: it’s not the best broom, but it will have to do;  this will do me, thanks.

definitions.definition: To be reasonable or acceptable.
definitions.example: It simply will not do to have dozens of children running around such a quiet event.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To have (as an effect).
definitions.example: The fresh air did him some good.

definitions.definition: To fare, perform (well or poorly).
definitions.example: Our relationship isn't doing very well;  how do you do?

definitions.definition: (chiefly in questions) To have as one's job.
definitions.example: What does Bob do? — He's a plumber.

definitions.definition: To perform the tasks or actions associated with (something).
definitions.example: "Don't forget to do your report" means something quite different depending on whether you're a student or a programmer.

definitions.definition: To cook.
definitions.example: I'll just do some eggs.

definitions.definition: To travel in, to tour, to make a circuit of.
definitions.example: Let’s do New York also.

definitions.definition: To treat in a certain way.
To work for or on, by way of caring for, looking after, preparing, cleaning, keeping in order, etc.
To act or behave in a certain manner; to conduct oneself.
To spend (time) in jail. (See also do time)
definitions.example: I did five years for armed robbery.

definitions.definition: To impersonate or depict.
definitions.example: They really laughed when he did Clinton, with a perfect accent and a leer.

definitions.definition: (with 'a' and the name of a person, place, event, etc.) To copy or emulate the actions or behaviour that is associated with the person or thing mentioned.
definitions.example: He did a Henry VIII and got married six times.

definitions.definition: To kill.
To deal with for good and all; to finish up; to undo; to ruin; to do for.
To punish for a misdemeanor.
definitions.example: He got done for speeding.

definitions.definition: To have sex with. (See also do it)
To cheat or swindle.
definitions.example: That guy just did me out of two hundred bucks!

definitions.definition: To convert into a certain form; especially, to translate.
definitions.example: the novel has just been done into English;  I'm going to do this play into a movie

definitions.definition: To finish.
To work as a domestic servant (with for).
(auxiliary) Used to form the present progressive of verbs.
To cash or to advance money for, as a bill or note.
(ditransitive) To make or provide.
definitions.example: Could you do me a burger with mayonnaise instead of ketchup?

definitions.definition: To injure (one's own body part).
To take drugs.
definitions.example: I do cocaine.

definitions.definition: (in the form be doing [somewhere]) To exist with a purpose or for a reason.
definitions.example: What's that car doing in our swimming pool?

definitions.definition: A column of a newspaper which contains advertisements relating to lost relatives and friends and other personal matters.
A column written by an agony aunt, giving advice on readers' personal problems.
A sudden jerk; a quick throw or cast; a darting motion
Someone who flirts a lot or enjoys flirting; a flirtatious person.
An act of flirting.
To throw (something) with a jerk or sudden movement; to fling.
definitions.example: They flirt water in each other's faces.

definitions.definition: To jeer at; to mock.
To dart about; to move with quick, jerky motions.
To blurt out.
To play at courtship; to talk with teasing affection, to insinuate sexual attraction in a playful (especially conversational) way.
To experiment, or tentatively engage, with; to become involved in passing with.
Pert; wanton
A government run by only a few, often the wealthy.
Those who make up an oligarchic government.
A state ruled by such a government.
A mixture consisting of beaten egg whites and sugar which is added to the tops of pies then browned.
A shell made of this mixture which serves as the receptacle for fruit, ice cream or sherbet.
definitions.example: Shirley likes to have strawberry with her meringue.
